Submodules¶

CactusTool.main module¶

class CactusTool.main.load(simname, basedir='~/simulations/', output=- 1)[source]¶

Bases: object

This is the main modular. Everything start from it.

Analysis(Thorn, fname=None)[source]¶

Analysis thorn’s output.

The current support is as follows: [multipole, volumeintegrals_grmhd, puncturetracker]

Parameters

  • thorn (str) – thorn name

  • fname (str) – File name

GF(dim='xy', ftype='h5')[source]¶

CarpetIOHDF5 or CarpetIOASCII output

Parameters

  • dim (str) – dimension

  • ftype (str) – endwith

Parfile(file=None)[source]¶

Load parameter file if it exist. You can change the default file by use ‘Parfile(<parameter file>)’.

Parameters

file (str) – parameter file in absolute path.

Scalar(ftype='maximum')[source]¶

CarpetIOScalar output

Parameters

ftype (str) – reduction operation

Module contents¶

CactusTool.LinePlot(ax, dsets, fmt=None, reflevel=- 1, unit='cactus', **kwargs)[source]¶

plot 1D Carpet data at a given iteration.

Parameters

  • ax – Which axes to use for the plot.

  • dsets (dict) – Dataset

  • reflevel (int) – only the refinement level specified in it will be displayed.

Parameters

CactusTool.UnitConversion(input_string)[source]¶

Parse a units expression.

The expression can only contain products, ratios and powers of units.

Parameters

input_string (str) – units expression

CactusTool.pcolormesh(ax, dsets, scale=None, unit='1', '1', label=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Create a pseudocolor 2-D plot.

Parameters

  • ax – Which axes to use for the plot.

  • dsets (dict) – AMRgrid data

  • scale (str) – log or not

  • kwargs – Unknown keyword arguments are passed to ax.pcolormesh().

Returns

image object
